pageContext.claim: “You don't come to court and ask for witnesses after you’ve already presented your case, unless you know your case is not working. I think their real motivation is for them to keep this President busy. We're doing a great job on the economy, we're building our military, look..... ....at the judges that we have right now. Previous quote from the great Republican Senator, Jim Inhofe, of Oklahoma - Chairman of the Senate Armed Services Committee”
pageContext.analysis: The Constitution says the Senate holds a trial in impeachment cases. Trials involve witness testimony. Republicans endeavored to shield Trump from the likely damaging testimony of his former national security adviser, John Bolton, who refused to testify during the House's impeachment proceedings but later said he would testify in the Senate trial, as a trial witness, if called. Both sides present their case and may call witnesses in Senate impeachment trials; the Republican majority simply refused to call any. But that was a departure from the norm. Every previous impeachment trial heard from witnesses.
